Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rabbi Mark Kaiserman, The Reform Temple of Forest Hills, 71-11 112th Street, Forest Hills, N.Y. 11375.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Koslowitz.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rabbi Mark Kaiserman, The Reform Temple of Forest Hills, 71-11 112th Street, Forest Hills, N.Y. 11375.

Council Member Koslowitz moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes

Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Dromm moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 14, 2016 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Greenfield:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application no. C 160367 ZSX shall be subject to Council review. This item is related to application nos. C 160365 ZMX and N 160366 ZRX, which are subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d(b)(1) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 1932 Bryant Avenue, Bronx (C160367 ZSX, C160365 ZMX and N160366 ZRX)

Items.Title:

Report of the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a 90-day transition period for displaced food service workers
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: 90-day transition period for displaced food service workers.

Items.Title: Resolution declaring support for Muslim communities, affirming the religious pluralism of the United States, and urging all residents to stand together for peace and understanding.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Declaring support for Muslim communities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the state and federal governments to amend their official forms and databases to accommodate multiracial identification in all instances where racial identification is required.

Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: State & federal governments to amend their official forms and databases to accommodate multiracial identification in all instances where racial identification is required.

The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).

There were 50 Council Members marked present for this Stated Meeting.
The Public Advocate (Ms James) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int No. 552-A, 49-1-0 (Negative; CM Deutsch);

See files for individual votes.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
